headline: 2025-10-27 — Ukrainian forces applied artificial intelligence to both air and land drones, integrating AI into 2 drone platform types (air drones and land drones) to help identify targets (reported by Reuters).

2025-10-28 — Taiwan's president convened 1 high-level meeting with senior ruling-party officials to review lessons from the Ukraine war and implications for Taiwan's defence posture (reported by Reuters).

2025-10-29 — China conducted experiments linking low-cost drones together into networked/small-swarm configurations (FT reported China is experimenting with low-cost drones linked together), i.e., 1 set of experimental linked-drone trials.

2025-10-30 — Bloomberg Markets published at least 1 breaking-markets bulletin contextualising AI-enabled drone developments amid global defence market moves, amplifying Reuters reporting on AI in drones (Bloomberg Markets coverage plus Reuters reporting this week).

2025-10-31 — Financial Times included the China low-cost linked-drone experimentation in its US & Canadian companies myFT Digest (FT noted China is experimenting with low-cost drones linked together), i.e., 1 digest inclusion drawing investor/industry attention.

2025-10-29 — As a follow-up to observed battlefield AI/drone use, Taiwan initiated 1 cross-department review of defensive measures against AI-enabled air and land drones (connection drawn between Reuters reporting on Ukraine AI-drones and Taiwan's policy interest).
